helper

Class ParallelExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • helper.ParallelExecutor

  • public final class ParallelExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
    Fire-and-forget parallel executor; uses runnables instead of callables to allow for exception propagation
    Author:
    Moritz Dorka

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ParallelExecutor.ThreadPool
      wrapper class to ensure only our own thread pools are used

      • execute

        public static void execute(java.lang.String namePrefix,
                           java.lang.Runnable... runnables)
        Execute parallel tasks which do not return anything
        Parameters:
        namePrefix - prefix of the names of the created threads
        runnables - a variable number of runnables to be executed in parallel
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the arguments is malformed

      • createThreadPool

        public static ParallelExecutor.ThreadPool createThreadPool(java.lang.String namePrefix,
                                                           int numThreads)
        Create a new fixed thread pool
        Parameters:
        namePrefix - name prefix to use for the new thread pool
        numThreads - number of threads to create
        Returns:
        newly created thread pool; never null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null
